titleStmt.title: Two acts I. An act for reviving two statutes lately expired, and making them perpetual; and for avoiding unnecessary suits and delays. II. An act for redress of inconveniences for want of proof of the deceases of persons beyond the seas, or absenting themselves, upon whose lives estates do depend.
Laws, etc.
titleStmt.author: Ireland.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Andrew Crook, printer to the King's Most Excellent Majesty, on Ormonde-Key.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in: William Andrews Clark Memorial Library, University of California, Los Angeles, California.
